articles.title: 14 Best Houseplants that Brighten Up Your Space
articles.desc: A brief description of the article would go here
articles.content:
It’s almost sly to use “14 Best Houseplants that Brighten Up your Space”. This is because I know how overwhelming it is to choose houseplants. It is also overwhelming for me to be objective when choosing the BEST houseplants because of swinging from personal preferences to readers’ preferences.
There are a variety of houseplants that are ideal for you. Before choosing a houseplant you should consider that:
There are over 10 000 houseplants species. Your choice will depend on your patience levels. Some take longer to bloom.
How to Choose Houseplants that Mirror Your Taste
When choosing plants consider your household members. Some houseplants are toxic to humans and pets. Therefore growing such plants among small adventurous children is inadvisable. Such houses should have edible houseplants with edible fruits if the houseplants are within reach. Also plants have different care levels. Some require regular pruning more sunlight or more water.
#1 Snake Plant
Snake plants are also known as the “unkillable” plants. They are easy to care for because they require little water for their maintenance. They also thrive in indirect light if the place is bright. However you should be patient with its blooming. Only older plants bloom and they rarely flower.

#2 Peace Lilies
Peace lilies are the best houseplants for a touch of elegance. Contrary to the snake plants peace lilies are flowering houseplants with its beautiful white flowers. You should expose them to more light if you want them to flower more or to lesser light if you want more foliage.

#3 Phalaenopsis Orchids
They are also flowering houseplants that require minimal watering- about once in a week. Additionally the plant blooms several times in a year.

#4 African Violet
African violets thrive better in warmer climates. Its ideal temperature is between 60-75 degrees. They are easy to care because their roots do not like soggy soils. Therefore ensure that your pot has a drainage hole. Also ensure that the soil has plenty of vermiculite and perlite which helps to control the moisture therefore keeping the plant vibrant.

#5 Zebra Plant
It is ideal for the windowsill. It requires plenty of bright indirect light. Also check the soil before watering because it is easy to overwater it causing root rot. Water it every few weeks.

#6 Orchid
Orchid is a low maintenance houseplant. Water it once in a week. Also place it where there is indirect low or bright sunlight. It is therefore a great plant for the office space.

#7 Algerian Ivy
It requires regular pruning for its fast-growing vines. It also requires regular watering and lots of shade.

#8 ZZ Plants
It is easy for beginners to care for the ZZ plants. For those that tend to underwater their plants this is a great plant for you. It is also tolerant to low light.

#9 Money Tree
Money trees can grow to up to eight feet indoors. Because of this you can prune the tree to the desired height. They symbolize luck good fortune and prosperity. Money trees are therefore a popular gift option across cultures. Most stems have five leaves that symbolize earth water fire metal and wind. Few stems may have extra leaves which people believe bring extra luck. Additionally people believe that the braided trunk also carries more fortune. It is also great for beginners for their easy care and its enduring nature. Water it only when the soil is dry. It needs watering once or twice in a week. Additionally they thrive in bright indirect sunlight. It is therefore easy to find a spot in your house that accommodates the money tree.

Read More
#10 Herbs
Generally house plants boost your health. Its aesthetical qualities and caring for them is therapeutic. Tending plants helps produce neurotransmitters such as dopamine and serotonin which are feel good hormones. The long term effect of purified air also includes reducing headaches. However herbs go a notch higher by encouraging you to cook healthier meals. Common herbs to include in your kitchen include sage chamomile mint thyme and basil. Herbs contain vitamins antioxidants and minerals. Some also alleviate anxiety.
#11 Succulents
Succulents thrive on very little care. This is because they are drought resistant meaning they need very little water. Popular succulents include the jade plant which increase moisture in a room or the Aloe Vera which is medicinal.

#12 Pothos
The heart-shaped leaved pants are easy to grow. They need infrequent watering and indirect sunlight. Pothos are known to lower indoor ozone levels which reduces the risk of inflammatory diseases.

#13 English Ivy
English Ivy reduces the levels of carbon dioxide and toxins in the air. They grow well in pots or hanging baskets. You can also train them to grow along a trellis or shape. For best care expose them to direct sunlight and ensure that the soil has sufficient water.

#14 Spider Plant
It is one of the best air purifying plants. It needs watering at least once in a week. Also place in a well-lit place.

Conclusion
Before rushing to pick the BEST plants for your house first understand your unique preference. There are plenty of articles on the best indoor plants. However you need to inject your personality in your selection to avoid feeling underwhelmed afterwards. My best houseplants may not be yours because of our unique likings. Houseplants variety of shapes colors sizes and functions to pick from. The best purifying plants may not be the most colorful plants.
FAQs
How do you choose the best houseplants?
Choose plants according to its purpose. Different plants work well in different rooms of the house. Also consider whether you are buying the plants for functional or decorative reasons. For example some houseplants are best as air purifiers some for their explosion of colors and some for their health benefits such as herbs.
What are the common mistakes to avoid when planting houseplants?
A common mistake is overwatering or under watering plants. Understand the different care levels of different plants. Therefore be consistent in your watering schedule and expose your plants to the right amount of sunlight. Leaves dropping may be an indication that you are watering the plants too much or too little. Also watch out for trunks that are soft and slimy or an unpleasant smell which may indicate root rot. What are the best air purification houseplants?
Snake plants peace lilies and English Ivy.

articles.title: Top 5 Ugliest Interior Designs to Avoid in Your Home
articles.desc: A brief description of the article would go here
articles.content:
Recently, I wrote an article on the best interior designs to incorporate into your home as a tenant. I read a couple of articles and found common ideas for creative and affordable designs to use.
C.R.E.A.T.I.V.I.T.Y and A.F.F.O.R.D.A.B.I.L.I.T.Y are the factors that influenced my choice of this article. While the internet has the best and worst interior designs, the worst designs often boil down to personal taste.
From avoiding white furniture or overindulging in golden accents, different interior designers have different opinions. For me, I keep this simple to 5 ugly interior decor. This is not an outdated thing, though it may be personal.
So, this article is unique from the other "worst interior deco" articles for my taste. That's why I use the word "ugly" for my title; worse is a disservice to my opinion.
Factors You Should Consider When Choosing Interior Designs
• Defying the rules- improvise
• Your Lifestyle
• Your space
• Symmetry
• Simplicity
• Blend textures
Read more about factors to consider when choosing your interior designs.
# 1 Using Newspapers on Walls and Ceilings
I recently visited a friend's house, and numerous pictures of beautiful ladies were cut out from newspapers. With further messages from the newspaper; "love me or leave me." I found this too rustic and obnoxious.
Why commit this disgrace to your home.
# 2 Using Cowhide Prints
Cowhide prints are some items some people find to be the in-thing. People often use cowhide prints in furniture and carpets.
It is a popular trend, but I find it ridiculous to have the skin of a cow in your home.
# 3 Overusing the Brown Color
How much space are you working with?
Brown is notorious for bringing warmth into a room. But excessive use, especially in a small room, brings darkness. Moreover, it needs many contrasting colors to make it attractive, which is difficult in small spaces.
# 4 Using Plastic Stands and Furniture
Plastics are an affordable option compared to a wooden pantry table. But Wooden pantry tables are more durable.
Plus, there is a hype to reduce plastics. Plastic stands add more trash to the environment in the long run. Additionally, plastics are uncomfortable because they lack the warmth of natural materials.
# 5 Converting your Home into a Forest
In my article, I mention a few of the best interior plants.
Plants infuse nature into your house. However, you want just enough plants to beautify your space rather than turning it into forestry.
Bonus Point
When going for plastic, choose from a minimalistic design that is simple and timeless. These plastics should be made from eco-friendly furniture.
Why Stick to 5 Ugly Designs?
I kept my article short because my taste largely influenced the article. My prior article on the best interior décor all boils down to infusing the house with your taste. Interior design also has to blend in with your lifestyle.
Being innovative with your personal touch is, therefore, crucial. To have affordable decos, some people go overboard by picking irking designs. You should create laughter and warmth in your home and avoid deco that stirs humor from their eccentric taste.
Should you go for minimalist or warm colors? What are the boundaries to these colors which make them cloyed or gaudy?
The answer is relative: personal taste, personal taste, personal taste.

articles.title: Decorating a Rental House on a Budget: DIY Ideas for Tenants
articles.desc: A brief description of the article would go here
articles.content:
After numerous searches, finding the "perfect" home is still arduous. This is because rental houses are different from an owner's house. After all, your own house follows your precise liking. Additionally, rented houses have the limits of rules in the lease agreement.
You may forego your deposit if you break these rules. However, you can still add a personal touch to a rental house, shifting it from a house to a home. Primarily, your decorative choice should resemble your personality and lifestyle. Therefore, you create memories using your style.
What You Need to Know Before Crafting Your Interior Design
You should carefully read the rental agreement to stick to the rules. Additionally, choose designs that are suitable to the lease term. For example, painting dark colors may be hectic if you intend to stay for a short duration because of the tones of colors it will take to paint it to the house’s original state. Therefore, the designs should be temporary and easy to remove. Lastly, ensure that the design is within your budget.
#1 Add Wall Designs
Walls are essential to the interior design because they define the home. Luckily, there are numerous options to choose from. Removable peel-and-stick wallpapers are an affordable option to use. Alternatively, you can paint accent walls. For this style, you can go for a bold or subtle design. Additionally, you may paint your walls. Lastly, you can add art and paintings that spruce up the wall.

#2 Use Stylish Storage
Such includes using an open shelf. Open shelves add appeal and create visual interest. Open shelves enable you to see the wall which creates more interest.
Storage baskets and belly baskets are also on trend. You can incorporate its numerous shapes and patterns into different layouts.
#3 Avoid Using Nails When Hanging Artwork
Use command hooks and strips to hang artwork and mirrors. Removable shelves are also a great idea because they are not drilled.
#4 Delineate Space
The soaring prices of houses in the urban areas make it essential to be creative with the limited space around you. Create unique definitions by setting the small spaces right. You may group furniture sets such as those in the dining room. This outlines and segregates different areas of your house.
Alternatively, you can differentiate the area with new furniture sets and design elements such as moveable bookshelves, screens, ottomans, and jaali partitions.
Use thinner paper or fabric to allow light to pass through. Heavier partitions may block light and sound.
#5 Use Indoor Plants
Greeneries infuse life and tranquility into your home. Greeneries are also an affordable and easy way to spruce up your house.
You can choose from various options such as hanging planters, freestanding plants, and adhesive hooks. However, choose plants whose branches only occupy little space or creep. These plants include ZZ Plants, money plants, ferns, kentia palm, swiss cheese plants, coffee plants, peace lilies, and snake plants.

#6 Use Flooring Accessories
Flooring accessories include rugs and carpets. They are a great way to add flair to a defective floor and protect it from damage. Rugs and carpets also add vibrancy, warmth, and texture. You can choose from designs such as woolen rugs and luxurious and contemporary flooring.
You can also incorporate artificial grass into your balcony.

#7 Redecorate the Windows and Doors
Change your curtains to geometric patterns and use satin drapes and rolling shutters. Using window treatments such as sheers and curtails may prevent UV lights that fade furniture. Window treatments help to create a more polished look. Therefore, window treatments help prolong your furniture’s lifespan.
You can add new paint or use new door designs such as veneer finish doors for the doors.

#8 Use Functional Modular Furniture
This furniture takes up moderate space. Therefore, they are ideal in a limited space. Modular furniture is an excellent choice for renters who are versatile and adaptable. You can also easily arrange the furniture to suit different needs and spaces. It is also easy to create various configurations and layouts.

#9 Update Your Cabinetry
Your kitchen space may need to be more congested and updated. You can create novelty by lighting the under-cabinet to illuminate it. You can also recreate the cabinet's look by adding new knobs and pulls and putting on wallpapers.
#10 Use Different Decorative Lighting Options
These include LED lights, chandeliers, pendant lights, and floor lights. Alternatively, you can renovate old switches and plugs by adding new colors or using wooden radiators. For example, an acrylic board with fixed patterns and lights adds flair to your ceiling.
Mood lighting is also a great way to add intensity, warmth, and color to a room. This switches things from a functional and harsh ambiance to a friendly ambiance.

#11 Buy Multi-Functional Furniture
Multi-functional furniture serves various needs and helps save space. An example is a sofa bed which is a bed by day and at night.

#12 Refurbish the Furniture
You can upgrade your furniture to blend with the look you have in mind. You may go for a rustic or a contemporary style. You may get rid of old furniture, repaint the furniture, or use slipcovers. Hence, use furniture with removable covers and cushions. Alternatively, you can design your home to rhyme with the old furniture.
#13 Invest in Mirrors
Mirrors give the illusion of space and light. Place a mirror near a window to amplify light and make the room airier.

Bonus Point
Be creative when arranging your home. Using vertical spaces such as bookcases and shelving units helps save on space. Additionally, you can take advantage of the space behind the door and use under-bed storage containers.
Also, consider the size of the bed in proportion to the room. Massive beds consume too much space.
Wrapping Up
It is easy for tenants to feel limited by a rental house design that needs to be spot on to their taste. But remember that the floor, walls, and other permanent designs don’t constitute a home. Your job is to create beautiful memories from your decorative style. Several temporary designs help add specialties and your unique personality. Therefore, these designs shift a house or a building structure to a home.
